Course type:
MSc
Programme specific course (MSc), Biomaterial Engineering for Medicine
Technological specialization course (MSc), Biomaterial Engineering for Medicine
Scope and form: Independent experimental work for 3 weeks 8 hours a day.
Type of assessment:
Oral examination and reports
Oral presentation of poster which is based on the project report (lab journal). Both the oral exam and the report need to be passed in order to pass the course.
Aid: All Aids - with access to the internet
Responsible: Martin Dufva , Lyngby Campus, Building 423 , dufva@dtu.dk
General course objectives:
General course objectives
To introduce students to the experimental techniques used in healthcare engineering.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
plan and carry out a sequence of experiments with a tight time schedule.
work with an open problem within healthcare engineering.
work in the lab with safety in focus.
participate constructively in a cross disciplinary research team.
use equipment and methods in a qualified manner and account for the operational principles.
account for the theoretical background behind the experiments.
analyse experimental data based on relevant theory.
account for and discuss experimental sources of error.
write a brief and precise commented lab-journal that makes the results useful also to the other team members.
present in a brief but precise manner the experimental results at a mini conference.
give constructive feedback to the written and oral presentations of the other groups.
Content: The course is an experimental project, and the content of the project is strongly related to the ongoing research at DTU Health Tech. Some of the projects will give you the opportunity to work with cell culture, fluorescent microscopy, 3D printing, drug delivery formulation, biomaterial testing, biosensor testing and similar fields of research. The project can be considered as a pre-MSc project.
Remarks: Students are encouraged to find their own supervisor for the project, eg. the supervisor they want for a future MSc project.
